fields: [{"name":"prompter","type":"Prompter","description":"A reference to the prompter for asking the user for input, e.g. text and images, for use in an application. For more information, please refer to the [Prompter documentation](docs/javalab/Prompter)."}]
name: Theater

methods.name: play
methods.content: Plays a `Scene` object, generating an animation and presenting it in Java Lab. There can be only one call to `play()`  or `playScenes()` per execution of a program.

methods.name: playScenes
methods.content: Plays the array of `Scene` objects provided, generating an animation and displaying it in Java Lab. There can be only one call to `play()`  or `playScenes()` per execution of a program.

methods.name: playScenes
methods.content: Plays all `Scene` objects provided as parameters to this call. This method uses a special feature of Java that allows for any number of `Scene` objects to be passed to the method without requiring an array to be created. There can be only one call to `play()`  or `playScenes()` per execution of a program.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"scenes","type":"Scene","required":true,"description":"one or more `Scene` objects to be played for the animation"}]
methods.examples:
[{"code":"To play multiple scenes in The Theater, you can either call `playScenes` with an array or simply pass in all the scenes in the order you want them to play:

```
Theater.playScenes(myFirstScene, mySecondScene, myThirdScene);
```"}]
